content:
ToolStripDropDownButton Class

Definition

Represents a control that when clicked displays an associated ToolStripDropDown from which the user can select a single item.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripItemDesignerAvailability(System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripItemDesignerAvailability.ToolStrip | System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripItemDesignerAvailability.StatusStrip)]
public class ToolStripDropDownButton : System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem

Remarks

ToolStripDropDownButton looks like ToolStripButton, but it shows a drop-down area when the user clicks it. Hide or show the drop-down arrow by setting the ShowDropDownArrow property. ToolStripDropDownButton hosts a ToolStripOverflowButton that displays items that overflow the ToolStrip.

Use the ToolStripDropDownButton to activate familiar drop-down controls such as color pickers. Set the ShowDropDownArrow property to true to more clearly indicate to the user that further options are available on the drop-down list.

Properties

AutoToolTip

Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use the Text property or the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.ToolTipText* property for the ToolStripDropDownButton ToolTip.

public bool AutoToolTip { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to use the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.Text* property for the ToolTip; otherwise, false. The default is true.

DefaultAutoToolTip

Gets a value indicating whether to display the ToolTip that is defined as the default.

protected override bool DefaultAutoToolTip { get; }
Value
Boolean

true in all cases.

ShowDropDownArrow

Gets or sets a value indicating whether an arrow is displayed on the ToolStripDropDownButton, which indicates that further options are available in a drop-down list.

public bool ShowDropDownArrow { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to show an arrow on the ToolStripDropDownButton; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Creates a generic ToolStripDropDown for which events can be defined.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown CreateDefaultDropDown ();
Returns

A ToolStripDropDown for which events can be defined.

OnMouseDown(MouseEventArgs)

Raises the MouseDown event.

protected override void OnMouseDown (System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs e);
e
MouseEventArgs

A MouseEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnMouseDown method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

Raises the MouseLeave event.

e

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnMouseLeave method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

e

e

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnPaint method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

ProcessMnemonic(Char)

Retrieves a value indicating whether the drop-down list of the ToolStripDropDownButton has items.

protected override bool ProcessMnemonic (char charCode);
charCode
Char

The character to process.

Returns
Boolean

true if the drop-down list has items; otherwise, false.
